intro: Ornithogalum sorgerae, commonly known as the Sorger's star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and clusters of star-shaped, white or pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its blooming period occurs during the spring and early summer, making it a notable addition to gardens with well-draining soil.
